net.gotev.uploadservice

Class MultipartUploadRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gotev.uploadservice.UploadRequest<B>
      • net.gotev.uploadservice.HttpUploadRequest<MultipartUploadRequest>
        • net.gotev.uploadservice.MultipartUploadRequest

  • public class MultipartUploadRequest
extends HttpUploadRequest<MultipartUploadRequest>
    HTTP/Multipart upload request. This is the most common way to upload files on a server. It's the same kind of request that browsers do when you use the <form> tag with one or more files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultipartUploadRequest(Context context, String serverUrl)
      Creates a new multipart upload request and automatically generates an upload id, that will be returned when you call UploadRequest.startUpload().
      MultipartUploadRequest(Context context, String uploadId, String serverUrl)
      Creates a new multipart upload request.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MultipartUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String path, String parameterName)
      Adds a file to this upload request, without setting file name and content type.
      MultipartUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String path, String parameterName, String fileName)
      Adds a file to this upload request, without setting the content type, which will be automatically detected from the file extension.
      MultipartUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String filePath, String parameterName, String fileName, String contentType)
      Adds a file to this upload request.
      MultipartUploadRequest setUtf8Charset()
      Sets the charset for this multipart request to UTF-8.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultipartUploadRequest

        public MultipartUploadRequest(Context context,
                              String uploadId,
                              String serverUrl)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException,
                              MalformedURLException
        Creates a new multipart upload request.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        uploadId - unique ID to assign to this upload request.
        It can be whatever string you want, as long as it's unique. If you set it to null or an empty string, an UUID will be automatically generated.
        It's advised to keep a reference to it in your code, so when you receive status updates in UploadServiceBroadcastReceiver, you know to which upload they refer to.
        serverUrl - URL of the server side script that will handle the multipart form upload. E.g.: http://www.yourcompany.com/your/script
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one or more arguments are not valid
        MalformedURLException - if the server URL is not valid

      • MultipartUploadRequest

        public MultipartUploadRequest(Context context,
                              String serverUrl)
                       throws MalformedURLException,
                              IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new multipart upload request and automatically generates an upload id, that will be returned when you call UploadRequest.startUpload().
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        serverUrl - URL of the server side script that will handle the multipart form upload. E.g.: http://www.yourcompany.com/your/script
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if one or more arguments are not valid
        MalformedURLException - if the server URL is not valid

    • Method Detail

      • addFileToUpload

        public MultipartUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String filePath,
                                              String parameterName,
                                              String fileName,
                                              String contentType)
                                       throws FileNotFoundException,
                                              IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a file to this upload request.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the file that you want to upload
        parameterName - Name of the form parameter that will contain file's data
        fileName - File name seen by the server side script. If null, the original file name will be used
        contentType - Content type of the file. You can use constants defined in ContentType class. Set this to null or empty string to try to automatically detect the mime type from the file. If the mime type can't be detected, application/octet-stream will be used by default
        Returns:
        MultipartUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist at the specified path
        IllegalArgumentException - if one or more parameters are not valid

      • addFileToUpload

        public MultipartUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String path,
                                              String parameterName,
                                              String fileName)
                                       throws FileNotFoundException,
                                              IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a file to this upload request, without setting the content type, which will be automatically detected from the file extension. If you want to manually set the content type, use addFileToUpload(String, String, String, String).
        Parameters:
        path - Absolute path to the file that you want to upload
        parameterName - Name of the form parameter that will contain file's data
        fileName - File name seen by the server side script. If null, the original file name will be used
        Returns:
        MultipartUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist at the specified path
        IllegalArgumentException - if one or more parameters are not valid

      • addFileToUpload

        public MultipartUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String path,
                                              String parameterName)
                                       throws FileNotFoundException,
                                              IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a file to this upload request, without setting file name and content type. The original file name will be used instead. If you want to manually set the file name seen by the server side script and the content type, use addFileToUpload(String, String, String, String)
        Parameters:
        path - Absolute path to the file that you want to upload
        parameterName - Name of the form parameter that will contain file's data
        Returns:
        MultipartUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist at the specified path
        IllegalArgumentException - if one or more parameters are not valid

      • setUtf8Charset

        public MultipartUploadRequest setUtf8Charset()
        Sets the charset for this multipart request to UTF-8. If not set, the standard US-ASCII charset will be used.
        Returns:
        request instance
